ARABIC: يَخَافُونَ رَبَّهُم مِّن فَوْقِهِمْ وَيَفْعَلُونَ مَا يُؤْمَرُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They fear their Lord above them and do everything they are ordered to do.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They have fear of God for His power over them, and act as commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They hold their Lord, Who is above them, in fear, and do as they are bidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They (angels) have fear of their Lord above them and fulfill His commands.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: They bear upon themselves the fear of their Lord, and do only what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They fear their Lord above them and do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: they fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They fear their Lord above them, and do what they are bidden.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: they fear their Lord above them, and do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They fear their Lord above them and do that which they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: They fear their Lord above them, and do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: They all revere their Lord, high above them, and they do all that they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: they fear their Lord from above them and do as they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [16:50] They, that is, the angels, fear (yakhāfūna is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the person governing [the verb] yastakbirūna, ‘they are [not] arrogant’) their Lord from above them (min fawqihim is a circumstantial qualifier referring to [the suffixed pronoun] -hum [of fawqihim]) in other words, [they fear their Lord], being High above them with the power to subjugate, and they do what they are commanded, to [do].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They fear their Lord above them) Who is above them on the throne, (and do) i.e. they say (what they are bidden) meaning the angels.
